title: Applicant pipeline dashboard

type.name: Deliverable
type.description: A product feature or update that aims to deliver new or improved functionality to users

body_html:
Summary

Develop a dashboard for agencies to view, filter, and track applicants through each stage of the grant application process.

Press release

Agencies now have access to an Applicant Pipeline Dashboard, providing real-time insights into applicant progress and streamlining the review process.

Acceptance criteria

  • Dashboard displays applicants by application stage.
  • Agencies can filter and search applicants in the dashboard.
  • Dashboard data updates in real time or near real time.

Metrics

  • Number of agencies actively using the dashboard
  • Average time applicants spend in each pipeline stage
  • Number of applicant stage transitions per month

title: Product analytics

type.name: Deliverable
type.description: A product feature or update that aims to deliver new or improved functionality to users

body_html:
Summary

Add product analytics to measure user engagement and feature adoption across the grants platform.

Press release

Today we’re launching new product analytics tools, giving our team insights into how users interact with the grants platform so we can improve the experience for everyone.

Acceptance criteria

  • Instrument key user flows with event tracking.
  • Dashboards display engagement metrics for core features.
  • Analytics respect user privacy and comply with federal policies.

Metrics

  • Daily/weekly/monthly active users
  • Feature adoption rates (e.g., bookmarks, applications started)
  • Average session duration

title: Opportunity pipeline dashboard

type.name: Deliverable
type.description: A product feature or update that aims to deliver new or improved functionality to users

body_html:
Summary

Develop an interactive dashboard that allows agencies and administrators to track the status and progression of grant opportunities from draft through publication, closure, and post-award activities.

Press release

Today we’re introducing the Opportunity Pipeline Dashboard—a powerful new tool that gives agencies real-time visibility into every stage of their grant opportunities. From initial draft to award closeout, users can now track progress, identify bottlenecks, and manage the lifecycle of opportunities more efficiently than ever before.

Acceptance criteria

  • Dashboard displays opportunities organized by key lifecycle stages (e.g., Draft, Review, Published, Closed, Post-Award).
  • Users can filter and search opportunities within the dashboard.
  • Status changes in opportunities are reflected in the dashboard in real time.

Metrics

  • Number of agencies using the opportunity pipeline dashboard
  • Average time opportunities spend in each lifecycle stage
  • Number of status transitions tracked in the dashboard per month

title: Opportunity publishing API

type.name: Deliverable
type.description: A product feature or update that aims to deliver new or improved functionality to users

body_html:
Summary

Build an API for federal agencies to programmatically publish grant opportunities, enabling automated, secure, and standardized listings.

Press release

We’re excited to launch the Opportunity Publishing API, making it easier for agencies to publish grant opportunities directly to our platform and keep listings current for all applicants.

Acceptance criteria

  • API accepts and validates required opportunity fields.
  • Documentation is published with usage instructions and examples.
  • Opportunities published via API appear in the platform within 5 minutes.

Metrics

  • Number of opportunities published via API per month
  • Average API submission-to-publication time
  • API error rate (failed vs. successful submissions)

title: Organizational profile

type.name: Deliverable
type.description: A product feature or update that aims to deliver new or improved functionality to users

body_html:
Summary

Allow organizations to create and manage profiles, centralizing information for applicants and agency partners.

Press release

Organizations can now create public profiles, showcasing their mission, team, and grant activity—all in one place for easier collaboration and discovery.

Acceptance criteria

  • Organizations can create and edit a profile with required fields.
  • Profiles are discoverable via search.
  • Admins can manage team members and organization details.

Metrics

  • Number of organizations with completed profiles
  • Profile view counts
  • Frequency of profile updates

title: Opportunity bookmarks

type.name: Deliverable
type.description: A product feature or update that aims to deliver new or improved functionality to users

body_html:
Summary

Enable applicants to bookmark grant opportunities for easy reference and personalized dashboards.

Press release

Applicants can now bookmark their favorite grant opportunities, making it easier to track and revisit programs that matter most to them.

Acceptance criteria

  • Users can bookmark/unbookmark opportunities from search and detail pages.
  • Bookmarked opportunities appear in a personalized dashboard.
  • Bookmarks persist across sessions for logged-in users.

Metrics

  • Number of opportunities bookmarked per user
  • Percentage of active users using bookmarks
  • Retention rate of bookmarked opportunities

title: Opportunity listing page

type.name: Deliverable
type.description: A product feature or update that aims to deliver new or improved functionality to users

body_html:
Sample press release

We’re thrilled to announce a major update to the SimplerFind feature! Starting today, applicants can learn more about grant opportunities in their search results without leaving simpler.grants.gov.

The newly designed opportunity synopsis page presents eligibility criteria, application deadlines, and more in an easy-to-understand format.

Plus, users can now share direct links to key sections, like the application package and the announcement PDF. These updates continue to help applicants find grant opportunities that meet their needs and qualifications.

Acceptance criteria

  • Listing page: Deliver a working opportunity listing page that at least allows users to learn about an opportunity (at least title and description) on simpler.grants.gov.
  • Download NOFO package: The opportunity listing page supports downloading the full text PDF of the NOFO in just one click.
  • Apply link: The opportunity listing page contains an “Apply” or “Learn more” link that directs user to the corresponding apply page or opportunity listing page on grants.gov.

Metrics

  • UI adoption: At least 5,000 unique users have viewed the opportunity listing via the user interface (UI).
  • API adoption: At least 5 unique users have accessed the opportunity listing directly from the API endpoint (i.e., not via the UI).
  • Conversion: Percent of users who click “Apply” or “Learn more” on the opportunity listing page is improving on a monthly basis
